Key Match Events: Bryce Harper slid home in a collision with catcher Gabriel Moreno as part of a double steal that built a 2-0 lead in the first off Zac Gallen.
Kyle Schwarber’s 6th inning drive traveled 461 feet over the swimming pool beyond the right-center fence.
J.T. Realmuto added a two-run homer in the eighth against Luis Frías for a 6-1 lead.
Pre-Game Insights: Zack Wheeler delivered another postseason gem with seven shutdown innings.
Bryson Stott hit an RBI single and Harper slid home in a collision with catcher Gabriel Moreno as part of a double steal that built a 2-0 lead in the first off Zac Gallen.
Schwarber’s homer was his fifth in the NLCS and 20th of his postseason career as the Philadelphia lineup roughed up Gallen for a second time this series.
Realmuto added a two-run homer in the eighth against Luis Frías for 6-1 lead.
Post-Match Reflections: Philadelphia moved one win from its second straight World Series appearance, regaining control after wasting late leads in consecutive one-run losses at Chase Field.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Philadelphia moved one win from its second straight World Series appearance, regaining control after wasting late leads in consecutive one-run losses at Chase Field.
Zack Wheeler, a 33-year-old right-hander, gave up one run and five hits with a walk while striking out eight.
The series resumes Monday in Philadelphia, where the Phillies are 6-0 this postseason with 17 homers.
